title: Chinese Banks in Two Key Cities Cut Mortgage Rates to Boost Housing Sector
sub_head: Cuts in Shanghai and Guangzhou, though modest, follow similar steps by dozens of smaller cities as home prices and sales weaken
body:
HONG KONG—Two of China’s largest and most prosperous cities have cut interest rates for prospective home buyers, joining an effort to prop up a housing sector whose weakness could threaten the broader economy.
Six of China’s largest state-owned banks, including Bank of China and Industrial and Commercial Bank of China , cut mortgage rates for home buyers in the southern city of Guangzhou by 0.2 percentage point Monday, according to state-run broadcaster China Central Television.
